snippet: The Roman Catholic Church, which removed its prohibition on cremation in 1963, is also urging its members not to store cremated remains at home....
abstract: Vatican issues new guidelines for cremation of dead, practice that has been rising in popularity among Catholics since church began allowing it in 1963; discourages faithful from scattering ashes or keeping them at home and reiterates preference for burial.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and GAIA PIANIGIANI
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Vatican City, and Gaia Pianigiani from Rome. Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The Roman Catholic Church, which removed its prohibition on cremation in 1963, is also urging its members not to store cremated remains at home.

headline.main: Vatican Clarifies the Rules for Cremation: Bury, Don’t Scatter
headline.print_headline: Vatican Clarifies  Cremation Rules:  Bury, Don’t Scatter
